revised_title: Investigating the Quantity and Velocity of the Solar Motion
tldr: Dr. William Herschel investigates the quantity and velocity of the solar motion using a method that involves analyzing the apparent motion of stars. He determines that the solar motion holds a middle rank among sidereal velocities and calculates the annual arch of the solar motion to be 1'116992 of a degree. This research provides a link between the principles of solar and sidereal motions and those responsible for orbital motions, opening up new avenues for understanding the solar system.
